Bilateral chronic serous otitis media.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Bilateral chronic serous otitis media.

persistent recurrent infections.context: The patient had a long history of persistent recurrent infections and was placed on antibiotics for the same.

thick mucoid material.context: At this point in time, he had a small amount of thick mucoid material in both middle ear spaces with middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed, but no active acute infection at this point in time.

inflamed middle ear mucosa.context: At this point in time, he had a small amount of thick mucoid material in both middle ear spaces with middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed, but no active acute infection at this point in time.

active acute infection.context: At this point in time, he had a small amount of thick mucoid material in both middle ear spaces with middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed, but no active acute infection at this point in time.

Bilateral myringotomies.context: Operation Performed: 1. Bilateral myringotomies.   2. Insertion of Shepard grommet draining tubes.

Insertion of Shepard grommet draining tu.context: Operation Performed: 1. Bilateral myringotomies.   2. Insertion of Shepard grommet draining tubes.

Floxin drops.context: Floxin drops were then instilled bilaterally to decrease any clotting within the tubes,

cotton ball.context: and then cotton ball was placed in the external meatus bilaterally.
